00007 package Value::Matrix;
00008 my $pkg = 'Value::Matrix';

00011 use Matrix; use Complex1;

00013 
00014 #
00015 #  Convert a value to a matrix.  The value can be:
00016 #     a list of numbers or list of (nested) references to arrays of numbers,
00017 #     a point, vector or matrix object, a matrix-valued formula, or a string
00018 #     that evaluates to a matrix
00019 #
00020 sub new {
00021   my $self = shift; my $class = ref($self) || $self;
00022   my $context = (Value::isContext($_[0]) ? shift : $self->context);
00023   my $M = shift; $M = [] unless defined $M; $M = [$M,@_] if scalar(@_) > 0;
00024   $M = @{$M}[0] if ref($M) =~ m/^Matrix(Real1)?/;
00025   $M = Value::makeValue($M,context=>$context) if ref($M) ne 'ARRAY';
00026   return bless {data => $M->data, context=>$context}, $class
00027     if (Value::classMatch($M,'Point','Vector','Matrix') && scalar(@_) == 0);
00028   return $M if Value::isFormula($M) && Value::classMatch($self,$M->type);
00029   my @M = (ref($M) eq 'ARRAY' ? @{$M} : $M);
00030   Value::Error("Matrices must have at least one entry") unless scalar(@M) > 0;
00031   return $self->matrixMatrix($context,@M) if ref($M[0]) eq 'ARRAY' ||
00032     Value::classMatch($M[0],'Matrix','Vector','Point') ||
00033     (Value::isFormula($M[0]) && $M[0]->type =~ m/Matrix|Vector|Point/);
00034   return $self->numberMatrix($context,@M);
00035 }
00036 
00037 #
00038 #  (Recursively) make a matrix from a list of array refs
00039 #  and report errors about the entry types
00040 #
00041 sub matrixMatrix {
00042   my $self = shift; my $class = ref($self) || $self;
00043   my $context = shift;
00044   my ($x,$m); my @M = (); my $isFormula = 0;
00045   foreach $x (@_) {
00046     if (Value::isFormula($x)) {push(@M,$x); $isFormula = 1} else {
00047       $m = $self->new($context,$x); push(@M,$m);
00048       $isFormula = 1 if Value::isFormula($m);
00049     }
00050   }
00051   my ($type,$len) = ($M[0]->entryType->{name},$M[0]->length);
00052   foreach $x (@M) {
00053     Value::Error("Matrix rows must all be the same type")
00054       unless (defined($x->entryType) && $type eq $x->entryType->{name});
00055     Value::Error("Matrix rows must all be the same length") unless ($len eq $x->length);
00056   }
00057   return $self->formula([@M]) if $isFormula;
00058   bless {data => [@M], context=>$context}, $class;
00059 }
00060 
00061 #
00062 #  Form a 1 x n matrix from a list of numbers
00063 #  (could become a row of an  m x n  matrix)
00064 #
00065 sub numberMatrix {
00066   my $self = shift; my $class = ref($self) || $self;
00067   my $context = shift;
00068   my @M = (); my $isFormula = 0;
00069   foreach my $x (@_) {
00070     $x = Value::makeValue($x,context=>$context);
00071     Value::Error("Matrix row entries must be numbers") unless Value::isNumber($x);
00072     push(@M,$x); $isFormula = 1 if Value::isFormula($x);
00073   }
00074   return $self->formula([@M]) if $isFormula;
00075   bless {data => [@M], context=>$context}, $class;
00076 }

00078 #
00079 #  Recursively get the entries in the matrix and return
00080 #  an array of (references to arrays of ... ) numbers
00081 #
00082 sub value {
00083   my $self = shift;
00084   my $M = $self->data;
00085   return @{$M} unless Value::classMatch($M->[0],'Matrix');
00086   my @M = ();
00087   foreach my $x (@{$M}) {push(@M,[$x->value])}
00088   return @M;
00089 }

00091 #
00092 #  Recursively get the dimensions of the matrix.
00093 #  Returns (n) for a 1 x n, or (n,m) for an n x m, etc.
00094 #
00095 sub dimensions {
00096   my $self = shift;
00097   my $r = $self->length;
00098   my $v = $self->data;
00099   return ($r,) unless Value::classMatch($v->[0],'Matrix');
00100   return ($r,$v->[0]->dimensions);
00101 }

00103 #
00104 #  Return the proper type for the matrix
00105 #
00106 sub typeRef {
00107   my $self = shift;
00108   return Value::Type($self->class, $self->length, $Value::Type{number})
00109     unless Value::classMatch($self->data->[0],'Matrix');
00110   return Value::Type($self->class, $self->length, $self->data->[0]->typeRef);
00111 }

00113 #
00114 #  True if the matrix is a square matrix
00115 #
00116 sub isSquare {
00117   my $self = shift;
00118   my @d = $self->dimensions;
00119   return 0 if scalar(@d) > 2;
00120   return 1 if scalar(@d) == 1 && $d[0] == 1;
00121   return $d[0] == $d[1];
00122 }
00123 
00124 #
00125 #  True if the matrix is 1-dimensional (i.e., is a matrix row)
00126 #
00127 sub isRow {
00128   my $self = shift;
00129   my @d = $self->dimensions;
00130   return scalar(@d) == 1;
00131 }
00132 
00133 #
00134 #  See if the matrix is an Indenity matrix
00135 #
00136 sub isOne {
00137   my $self = shift;
00138   return 0 unless $self->isSquare;
00139   my $i = 0;
00140   foreach my $row (@{$self->{data}}) {
00141     my $j = 0;
00142     foreach my $k (@{$row->{data}}) {
00143       return 0 unless $k eq (($i == $j)? "1": "0");
00144       $j++;
00145     }
00146     $i++;
00147   }
00148   return 1;
00149 }
00150 
00151 #
00152 #  See if the matrix is all zeros
00153 #
00154 sub isZero {
00155   my $self = shift;
00156   foreach my $x (@{$self->{data}}) {return 0 unless $x->isZero}
00157   return 1;
00158 }

00160 #
00161 #  Make arbitrary data into a matrix, if possible
00162 #
00163 sub promote {
00164   my $self = shift; my $class = ref($self) || $self;
00165   my $context = (Value::isContext($_[0]) ? shift : $self->context);
00166   my $x = (scalar(@_) ? shift : $self);
00167   return $self->new($context,$x,@_) if scalar(@_) > 0 || ref($x) eq 'ARRAY';
00168   $x = Value::makeValue($x,context=>$context);
00169   return $x->inContext($context) if ref($x) eq $class;
00170   return $self->make($context,@{$x->data}) if Value::classMatch($x,'Point','Vector');
00171   Value::Error("Can't convert %s to %s",Value::showClass($x),Value::showClass($self));
00172 }

00175 #  Don't inherit ColumnVector flag
00176 #
00177 sub noinherit {
00178   my $self = shift;
00179   return ("ColumnVector",$self->SUPER::noinherit);

00187 sub add {
00188   my ($self,$l,$r,$other) = Value::checkOpOrderWithPromote(@_);
00189   my @l = @{$l->data}; my @r = @{$r->data};
00190   Value::Error("Can't add Matrices with different dimensions")
00191     unless scalar(@l) == scalar(@r);
00192   my @s = ();
00193   foreach my $i (0..scalar(@l)-1) {push(@s,$l[$i] + $r[$i])}
00194   return $self->inherit($other)->make(@s);
00195 }
00196 
00197 sub sub {
00198   my ($self,$l,$r,$other) = Value::checkOpOrderWithPromote(@_);
00199   my @l = @{$l->data}; my @r = @{$r->data};
00200   Value::Error("Can't subtract Matrices with different dimensions")
00201     unless scalar(@l) == scalar(@r);
00202   my @s = ();
00203   foreach my $i (0..scalar(@l)-1) {push(@s,$l[$i] - $r[$i])}
00204   return $self->inherit($other)->make(@s);
00205 }
00206 
00207 sub mult {
00208   my ($l,$r,$flag) = @_; my $self = $l; my $other = $r;
00209   #
00210   #  Constant multiplication
00211   #
00212   if (Value::matchNumber($r) || Value::isComplex($r)) {
00213     my @coords = ();
00214     foreach my $x (@{$l->data}) {push(@coords,$x*$r)}
00215     return $self->make(@coords);
00216   }
00217   #
00218   #  Make points and vectors into columns if they are on the right
00219   #
00220   if (!$flag && Value::classMatch($r,'Point','Vector'))
00221     {$r = ($self->promote($r))->transpose} else {$r = $self->promote($r)}
00222   #
00223   if ($flag) {my $tmp = $l; $l = $r; $r = $tmp}
00224   my @dl = $l->dimensions; my @dr = $r->dimensions;
00225   if (scalar(@dl) == 1) {@dl = (1,@dl); $l = $self->make($l)}
00226   if (scalar(@dr) == 1) {@dr = (@dr,1); $r = $self->make($r)->transpose}
00227   Value::Error("Can only multiply 2-dimensional matrices") if scalar(@dl) > 2 || scalar(@dr) > 2;
00228   Value::Error("Matices of dimensions %dx%d and %dx%d can't be multiplied",@dl,@dr)
00229     unless ($dl[1] == $dr[0]);
00230   #
00231   #  Do matrix multiplication
00232   #
00233   my @l = $l->value; my @r = $r->value; my @M = ();
00234   foreach my $i (0..$dl[0]-1) {
00235     my @row = ();
00236     foreach my $j (0..$dr[1]-1) {
00237       my $s = 0;
00238       foreach my $k (0..$dl[1]-1) {$s += $l[$i]->[$k] * $r[$k]->[$j]}
00239       push(@row,$s);
00240     }
00241     push(@M,$self->make(@row));
00242   }
00243   $self = $self->inherit($other) if Value::isValue($other);
00244   return $self->make(@M);
00245 }
00246 
00247 sub div {
00248   my ($l,$r,$flag) = @_; my $self = $l;
00249   Value::Error("Can't divide by a Matrix") if $flag;
00250   Value::Error("Matrices can only be divided by Numbers")
00251     unless (Value::matchNumber($r) || Value::isComplex($r));
00252   Value::Error("Division by zero") if $r == 0;
00253   my @coords = ();
00254   foreach my $x (@{$l->data}) {push(@coords,$x/$r)}
00255   return $self->make(@coords);
00256 }
00257 
00258 sub power {
00259   my ($l,$r,$flag) = @_; my $self = shift; my $context = $self->context;
00260   Value::Error("Can't use Matrices in exponents") if $flag;
00261   Value::Error("Only square matrices can be raised to a power") unless $l->isSquare;
00262   $r = Value::makeValue($r,context=>$context);
00263   Value::Error("Matrix powers must be non-negative integers") unless $r->isNumber && $r =~ m/^\d+$/;
00264   return $context->Package("Matrix")->I($l->length,$context) if $r == 0;
00265   my $M = $l; foreach my $i (2..$r) {$M = $M*$l}
00266   return $M;
00267 }

00269 #
00270 #  Do lexicographic comparison (row by row)
00271 #
00272 sub compare {
00273   my ($self,$l,$r) = Value::checkOpOrderWithPromote(@_);
00274   Value::Error("Can't compare Matrices with different dimensions")
00275     unless join(',',$l->dimensions) eq join(',',$r->dimensions);
00276   my @l = @{$l->data}; my @r = @{$r->data};
00277   foreach my $i (0..scalar(@l)-1) {
00278     my $cmp = $l[$i] <=> $r[$i];
00279     return $cmp if $cmp;
00280   }
00281   return 0;
00282 }

00284 sub neg {
00285   my $self = promote(@_); my @coords = ();
00286   foreach my $x (@{$self->data}) {push(@coords,-$x)}
00287   return $self->make(@coords);
00288 }

00290 #
00291 #  Transpose an  n x m  matrix
00292 #
00293 sub transpose {
00294   my $self = promote(@_);
00295   my @d = $self->dimensions;
00296   if (scalar(@d) == 1) {@d = (1,@d); $self = $self->make($self)}
00297   Value::Error("Can't transpose %d-dimensional matrices",scalar(@d)) unless scalar(@d) == 2;
00298   my @M = (); my $M = $self->data;
00299   foreach my $j (0..$d[1]-1) {
00300     my @row = ();
00301     foreach my $i (0..$d[0]-1) {push(@row,$M->[$i]->data->[$j])}
00302     push(@M,$self->make(@row));
00303   }
00304   return $self->make(@M);
00305 }

00307 #
00308 #  Get an identity matrix of the requested size
00309 #
00310 sub I {
00311   my $self = shift; my $d = shift; my $context = shift || $self->context;
00312   $d = ($self->dimensions)[0] if !defined $d && ref($self) && $self->isSquare;
00313   Value::Error("You must provide a dimension for the Identity matrix") unless defined $d;
00314   Value::Error("Dimension must be a positive integer") unless $d =~ m/^[1-9]\d*$/;
00315   my @M = (); my @Z = split('',0 x $d);
00316   foreach my $i (0..$d-1) {
00317     my @row = @Z; $row[$i] = 1;
00318     push(@M,$self->make($context,@row));
00319   }
00320   return $self->make($context,@M);
00321 }

00323 #
00324 #  Extract a given row from the matrix
00325 #
00326 sub row {
00327   my $self = (ref($_[0]) ? $_[0] : shift);
00328   my $M = $self->promote(shift); my $i = shift;
00329   return if $i == 0; $i-- if $i > 0;
00330   if ($M->isRow) {return if $i != 0 && $i != -1; return $M}
00331   return $M->data->[$i];
00332 }
00333 
00334 #
00335 #  Extract a given column from the matrix
00336 #
00337 sub column {
00338   my $self = (ref($_[0]) ? $_[0] : shift);
00339   my $M = $self->promote(shift); my $j = shift;
00340   return if $j == 0; $j-- if $j > 0;
00341   my @d = $M->dimensions;
00342   if (scalar(@d) == 1) {
00343     return if $j+1 > $d[0] || $j < -$d[0];
00344     return $M->data->[$j];
00345   }
00346   return if $j+1 > $d[1] || $j < -$d[1];
00347   my @col = ();
00348   foreach my $row (@{$M->data}) {push(@col,$self->make($row->data->[$j]))}
00349   return $self->make(@col);
00350 }
00351 
00352 #
00353 #  Extract a given element from the matrix
00354 #
00355 sub element {
00356   my $self = (ref($_[0]) ? $_[0] : shift);
00357   my $M = $self->promote(shift);
00358   return $M->extract(@_);
00359 }

00366 ##################################################
00367 #
00368 #  Convert MathObject Matrix to old-style Matrix
00369 #
00370 sub wwMatrix {
00371   my $self = (ref($_[0]) ? $_[0] : shift);
00372   my $M = $self->promote(shift); my $j = shift; my $wwM;
00373   return $self->{wwM} if defined($self->{wwM});
00374   my @d = $M->dimensions;
00375   Value->Error("Matrix must be two-dimensional to convert to MatrixReal1") if scalar(@d) > 2;
00376   if (scalar(@d) == 1) {
00377     $wwM = new Matrix(1,$d[0]);
00378     foreach my $j (0..$d[0]-1) {
00379       $wwM->[0][0][$j] = $self->wwMatrixEntry($M->data->[$j]);
00380     }
00381   } else {
00382     $wwM = new Matrix(@d);
00383     foreach my $i (0..$d[0]-1) {
00384       my $row = $M->data->[$i];
00385       foreach my $j (0..$d[1]-1) {
00386     $wwM->[0][$i][$j] = $self->wwMatrixEntry($row->data->[$j]);
00387       }
00388     }
00389   }
00390   $self->{wwM} = $wwM;
00391   return $wwM;
00392 }
00393 sub wwMatrixEntry {
00394   my $self = shift; my $x = shift;
00395   return $x->value if $x->isReal;
00396   return Complex1::cplx($x->Re->value,$x->Im->value) if $x->isComplex;
00397   return $x;
00398 }
00399 sub wwMatrixLR {
00400   my $self = shift;
00401   return $self->{lrM} if defined($self->{lrM});
00402   $self->wwMatrix;
00403   $self->{lrM} = $self->{wwM}->decompose_LR;
00404   return $self->{lrM};
00405 }

00448 sub normalize {

00450   my $v = $self->new(shift)->wwMatrix;

00452   return ($self->new($M),$self->new($b));

00459   return ($d,$self->new($b),$self->new($M));

00473 sub solve_GSM {
00474   my $self = shift;
00475   my $x0 = $self->new(shift)->wwMatrix;
00476   my $b  = $self->new(shift)->wwMatrix;
00477   my $e  = shift;
00478   my $v = $self->wwMatrix->solve_GSM($x0,$b,$e);
00479   $v = $self->new($v) if defined($v);
00480   return $v;

00551 ############################################
00552 #
00553 #  Generate the various output formats
00554 #
00555 
00556 #
00557 #  Use array environment to lay out matrices
00558 #
00559 sub TeX {
00560   my $self = shift; my $equation = shift;
00561   my $def = ($equation->{context} || $self->context)->lists->get('Matrix');
00562   my $open  = shift || $self->{open} || $def->{open};
00563   my $close = shift || $self->{close} || $def->{close};
00564   $open =~ s/([{}])/\\$1/g; $close =~ s/([{}])/\\$1/g;
00565   my $TeX = ''; my @entries = (); my $d;
00566   if ($self->isRow) {
00567     foreach my $x (@{$self->data}) {
00568       if (Value::isValue($x)) {
00569     $x->{format} = $self->{format} if defined $self->{format};
00570     push(@entries,$x->TeX($equation));
00571       } else {push(@entries,$x)}
00572     }
00573     $TeX .= join(' &',@entries) . "\n";
00574     $d = scalar(@entries);
00575   } else {
00576     foreach my $row (@{$self->data}) {
00577       foreach my $x (@{$row->data}) {
00578     if (Value::isValue($x)) {
00579       $x->{format} = $self->{format} if defined $self->{format};
00580       push(@entries,$x->TeX($equation));
00581     } else {push(@entries,$x)}
00582       }
00583       $TeX .= join(' &',@entries) . '\cr'."\n";
00584       $d = scalar(@entries); @entries = ();
00585     }
00586   }
00587   $TeX =~ s/\\cr\n$/\n/;
00588   return '\left'.$open.'\begin{array}{'.('c'x$d).'}'."\n".$TeX.'\end{array}\right'.$close;
00589 }
